comments.content: It's a long shot, but I think "Capital" looks like a heavily modified **[Frutiger Neue (Black)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416002027/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Monotype%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Frutiger%20Neue%20LT%20W1G%20-%20Black%20Bold&fid=3f69bbbc163af331b5cfe290cf4ec2e3&fstyle=i&fsize=60&text=Capital&fit=1)** - I can't find something closer...

Agree Frutiger Black's \_C\_ and \_p\_ would be a good basis for modification to make the logo. Also the top stroke on \_a\_.  
But the lower bowl on \_a\_, with its compound curve to meet the vertical, is closer to Folio Bold [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/folio/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416002027/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/folio/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/folio/") which also has a closer shape for the foot on the vertical stroke of \_a\_.  
Don

Here are links to eps versions of the Capital One logo [http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/logo/capital-one-2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416002027/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/logo/capital-one-2 "http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/logo/capital-one-2") [http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/logo/capitalone-bank](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416002027/http:/www.brandsoftheworld.com/logo/capitalone-bank "http://www.brandsoftheworld.com/logo/capitalone-bank")  
Needless to say these are registered trademarks and use for anything other than examination of the design, without the express permission of the copyright and/or trademark holder, would raise legal issues.  
Don
